trans-unit.source: Retrieves a reference to a COM object from an existing process or filename.

seg-source.mrk: Retrieves a reference to a COM object from an existing process or filename.

target.mrk: Retrieves a reference to a COM object from an existing process or filename.

trans-unit.source: The full path and name to the file containing the object (See remarks).

seg-source.mrk: The full path and name to the file containing the object (See remarks).

target.mrk: The full path and name to the file containing the object (See remarks).

trans-unit.source: [optional] Class identifier. Can be in either ProgID or the string representation of the CLSID.

seg-source.mrk: Can be in either ProgID or the string representation of the CLSID.

target.mrk: Can be in either ProgID or the string representation of the CLSID.

trans-unit.source: [optional] Instance of the object for ROT objects of the same (co)class.

seg-source.mrk: Instance of the object for ROT objects of the same (co)class.

target.mrk: Instance of the object for ROT objects of the same (co)class.

trans-unit.source: The filename is optional if you want to use only the class identifier, but the parameter can't be omitted.

seg-source.mrk: The filename is optional if you want to use only the class identifier, but the parameter can't be omitted.

target.mrk: The filename is optional if you want to use only the class identifier, but the parameter can't be omitted.

trans-unit.source: Use an empty string if you want to access objects from running objects table (ROT). You can use third parameter to specify wanted instance in that case.

seg-source.mrk: Use an empty string if you want to access objects from running objects table (ROT).
You can use third parameter to specify wanted instance in that case.

target.mrk: Use an empty string if you want to access objects from running objects table (ROT).
You can use third parameter to specify wanted instance in that case.

trans-unit.source: In all other cases third parameter is ignored.

seg-source.mrk: In all other cases third parameter is ignored.

target.mrk: In all other cases third parameter is ignored.

trans-unit.source: If you use a filename, the classname is optional. It's only required when you want to load an object of a specific class.

seg-source.mrk: If you use a filename, the classname is optional.
It's only required when you want to load an object of a specific class.

target.mrk: If you use a filename, the classname is optional.
It's only required when you want to load an object of a specific class.

trans-unit.source: Classname parameter does not have default value. If it's specified then it's processed.

seg-source.mrk: Classname parameter does not have default value.
If it's specified then it's processed.

target.mrk: Classname parameter does not have default value.
If it's specified then it's processed.

trans-unit.source: See the Obj/COM Reference for more information about Objects.

seg-source.mrk: See the Obj/COM Reference for more information about Objects.

target.mrk: See the Obj/COM Reference for more information about Objects.

target.mrk: ; An Excel file with filename Worksheet.xls must be created in the script directory

trans-unit.source: in order for this example to work.

target.mrk: in order for this example to work.

trans-unit.source: Tip: Uncomment these lines to make Excel visible (credit: DaleHohm)

seg-source.mrk: Uncomment these lines to make Excel visible (credit:

target.mrk: Uncomment these lines to make Excel visible (credit:

trans-unit.source: $oExcelDoc.Windows(1).Visible = 1; Set the first worksheet in the workbook visible

seg-source.mrk: Visible = 1; Set the first worksheet in the workbook visible

target.mrk: Visible = 1; Set the first worksheet in the workbook visible

trans-unit.source: $oExcelDoc.Application.Visible = 1; Set the application visible (without this Excel will exit)

seg-source.mrk: Visible = 1; Set the application visible (without this Excel will exit)

target.mrk: Visible = 1; Set the application visible (without this Excel will exit)
